current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

cosponsor.#tail: ) submitted the following resolution; which was considered and agreed to

text.#text:
encourages members of Congress, schools, local businesses, nonprofit  institutions, churches,
			 cities, and State governments to assist in efficient use of summer food
			 service program
			 sites by raising awareness of the  location and availability of those
			 sites;

encourages members of Congress, schools, local businesses, nonprofit institutions, churches,
			 cities, and State governments to  support efforts to increase the
			 participation rate of
			 eligible children who,  without the summer food service program for
			 children established under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 13 of the Richard B. Russell National
			 School Lunch Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act/s:13

text.#text:
encourages members of Congress to visit a summer food service program site to see the importance of
			 the program
			 firsthand.
Whereas 1 in 5 children in the United States struggle with hunger;

Whereas research has found that more than 30 percent of low-income families do not have
			 enough food during the summer months;
Whereas the summer food service program for children established under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 13 of the Richard B.
			 Russell National School Lunch Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act/s:13

text.#text:
Whereas summer programs are often under-utilized, as only 1 in 6 eligible children participate
			 in the summer food service program, due in part to families being unaware
			 that the
			 summer food service program exists;

Whereas lack of transportation and other barriers often prevent children from accessing the summer
			 food service program sites,
			 especially in rural areas; and

Whereas almost 1 in 3 low-income children live in communities that are not eligible to
			 participate in the summer food service program, thus reducing their
			 ability to participate in the program: Now, therefore, be it

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 SRES 495 ATS: Designating July 2014 as “Summer Meals Awareness Month”.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}rights.#text: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
